content.content1: Ingredients: Cous-cous 4 large field mushrooms Baby Sweetcorn Baby courgette 1 onion 2 sweet peppers Chicken OXO cube Garlic granules Garden herbs Olive oil Butter To Make: Chop onion and gently sweat down with oregano, some olive oil and a very small amount of butter. Make cous-cous with chicken stock cube for flavour - DON'T use too much water... When the onions have started to sweat down, add VERY finely chopped courgette and sweetcorn. Cook on a low heat for about 15 minutes until everything is sweetened and tender. Finely chop a handful of garden herbs, and mix in with cous-cous along with the fried onions. Mix till all nice... [Send muggins to supermarket to get Pinot Grigiot] Carefully cut the peppers in half, cutting through the middle of the stalk. Remove all seeds and that big thick knobbly bit that has all the seeds attached ;-). Carefully remove the stalk from the middle of the mushrooms as well. Stuff stuff wiv cous-cous. (get your 'ands in - its a bit easier). Also, you might want to use a small amount of olive oil to bind the cous-cous. Sprinkle with grated parmisan (as much as you think is appropriate...) put in oven on 1700C for about 20 minutes, or until mushes are cooked. Serve with whatever you like meat-wise (reccommend pork chops) Enjoy
